description: Returns all State Manager associations in the current Amazon Web Services account and Amazon Web Services Region. You can limit the results to a specific State Manager association document or managed node by specifying a filter. State Manager is a tool in Amazon Web Services Systems Manager.

parameters.name: AssociationFilterList
parameters.description: One or more filters. Use a filter to return a more specific list of results. (dict) --- Describes a filter. The name of the filter. The filter value.

nested_items.name: Associations
nested_items.description: The associations.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the SSM document.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The managed node ID.

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: The ID created by the system when you create an association. An association is a binding between a document and a set of targets with a schedule.

nested_items.name: AssociationVersion
nested_items.description: The association version.

nested_items.name: DocumentVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the document used in the association. If you change a document version for a State Manager association, Systems Manager immediately runs the association unless you previously specifed the apply-only-at-cron-interval parameter.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: The managed nodes targeted by the request to create an association. You can target all managed nodes in an Amazon Web Services account by specifying the InstanceIds key with a value of *.
Key=tag-key,Values=tag-value-1,tag-value-2

nested_items.name: LastExecutionDate
nested_items.description: The date on which the association was last run.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the association. Status can be: Pending, Success, or Failed.

nested_items.name: DetailedStatus
nested_items.description: A detailed status of the association.

nested_items.name: AssociationStatusAggregatedCount
nested_items.description: Returns the number of targets for the association status. For example, if you created an association with two managed nodes, and one of them was successful, this would return the count of managed nodes by status.
(string) ---
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: ScheduleExpression
nested_items.description: A cron expression that specifies a schedule when the association runs. The schedule runs in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: AssociationName
nested_items.description: The association name.

nested_items.name: ScheduleOffset
nested_items.description: Number of days to wait after the scheduled day to run an association.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: The number of hours that an association can run on specified targets. After the resulting cutoff time passes, associations that are currently running are cancelled, and no pending executions are started on remaining targets.

nested_items.name: TargetMaps
nested_items.description: A key-value mapping of document parameters to target resources. Both Targets and TargetMaps can't be specified together.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are no additional items to return, the string is empty.
